paragraph.heading:
Meeboldia delavayi (Franch.) W.Gou & X.J.He
,
comb. nov.
( Fig. 5 )

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type. China . Yunnan : in rupibus calcareis ad fauces, montis Pee-cha-ho, prope Mo-so-yn,
31. 08. 1884
, Delavay 945 ( lectotype P !, designated by Pimenov 2017: 221 ; isolectotypes P !)
.

=
Meeboldia yunnanensis (H.Wolff) Constance & F.T.Pu ex S.L.Liou (1998: 70)

Type. China . Yunnan : Yunnan-fu , Cavalerie 422 ( holotype P !)
.

Type. China . Yunnan
,
region of Tungshan, Yangtze drainage bassin, east of Likiang , 1923, Rock 10499 ( lectotype E !, designated by Pimenov 2017:222 ; isolectotypes UC !, US !)
.

Type. China . Yunnan , West China : Mekong-Salwin divide, Lat. 28°10’ N , 09. 1914, Forrest 13263 ( lectotype E !, designated by Pimenov 2017:222 )
.

Recognition.
M. delavayi
was sometimes confused with
H. zhongdianensis
, but can be easily distinguished by their ribs of fruits (linear vs. winged) and bracts length ( 2–4 mm vs. 7–9 mm ) ( Table 3 ).

Description. Herbs perennial. Plants 40–80 cm . Taproot fusiform several branched with cyclic striae. Stems striped. Basal petioles 5–20 cm , sheaths short, membranous, perished leaf sheaths flaky or fibrous; basal blade 3–4- pinnate, 8–15 × 4–12 cm ; pinnae 6–9 pairs, lower pinnae long-petiolulate; terminal leaflets subulate or antler-shaped or less dissected obovate, 3–10 × 1–4 mm , deeply lobed or irregularly serrate. Leaves reduced upwards, uppermost small, shortly petiolate or sessile. Umbels 4–7 cm across; peduncles 8–25 cm ; rays 5–8, 3– 5 cm , spreading; Bracts 1–3, linear-subulate, 2–4 × 0.5 mm , with minute white edge; bracteoles 6–7, linear, ca. 3mm , with minute white edge; pedicels unequal. Petals white, broadly ovoid, apex inflexed, medial rib obvious, ca. 1.2 × 1 mm . Stylopodium shortconic. Fruit oblong-ovate, mericarp ca. 3–4 × 2 mm , commissure ca. 1.6 mm in width; calyx teeth subulate, 0.4–0.6 mm ; ribs filiform, 2–3 vallecular vittae, 4 commissural vittae.
Phenology. Found flowering in July–September, fruiting in September–October.

Distribution and habitat. China , Sichuan , Daocheng, Tibetan Autonomous County of Muli. Yunnan , Zhongdian, Kunming, Dali Bai Autonomous Prefecture. It grows in mountain slopes of the valley, grassy places of the forest edge. At elevations between 1400 and 3500 m .
